t: Ezekiel 24
Symbol of the Cooking Pot
Again,*p in the ninth year, in the tenth month, on the tenth day*i of the month, the word of the Lord*s came to me, saying,
“Son of man, write down the name of the day, this very day—the king of Babylon started his siege against Jerusalem this very day.
And utter a parable to the rebellious house, and say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord God:*s “Put*pn on a pot, set it*i on, And*ld also pour water into it.
Gather*ld pieces of*i meat*i in it, Every*ld good piece, The*ld thigh and the shoulder. Fill*ld it*i with choice cuts;
Take*ld the choice of the flock. Also*ld pile fuel*i bones under it, Make*ld it boil well, And*ld let the cuts simmer in it.”

‘Therefore*p thus says the Lord God:*s “Woe*pn to the bloody city, To*ld the pot whose scum is*i in it, And*ld whose scum is not gone from it! Bring*ld it out piece by piece, On*ld which no lot has fallen.
For*ld her blood is in her midst; She*ld set it on top of a rock; She*ld did not pour it on the ground, To*ld cover it with dust.
That*ld it may raise up fury and take vengeance, I*ld have set her blood on top of a rock, That*ld it may not be covered.”
‘Therefore*p thus says the Lord God:*s “Woe*pn to the bloody city! I*ld too will make the pyre great.
Heap*ld on the wood, Kindle*ld the fire; Cook*ld the meat well, Mix*ld in the spices, And*ld let the cuts be burned up.
“Then*ln set the pot empty on the coals, That*ld it may become hot and its bronze may burn, That*ild its filthiness may be melted in it, That*ild its scum may be consumed.
She*ld has grown weary with lies, And*ld her great scum has not gone from her. Let*ild her scum be*i in the fire!
In*ld your filthiness is*i lewdness. Because*ld I have cleansed you, and you were not cleansed, You*ld will not be cleansed of your filthiness anymore, Till*ld I have caused My fury to rest upon you.

I,*ld the Lord,*s have spoken it;*i It*ld shall come to pass, and I will do it;*i I*ld will not hold back, Nor*ld will I spare, Nor*ld will I relent; According*ld to your ways And*ld according to your deeds They*ld will judge you,” Says*ld the Lord God.’”*s
The Prophet’s Wife Dies
Also*p the word of the Lord*s came to me, saying,
“Son of man, behold, I take away from you the desire of your eyes with one stroke; yet you shall neither mourn nor weep, nor shall your tears run down.
Sigh in silence, make no mourning for the dead; bind your turban on your head, and put your sandals on your feet; do not cover your*i lips, and do not eat man’s bread of*i sorrow.”*i
So*p I spoke to the people in the morning, and at evening my wife died; and the next morning I did as I was commanded.
And*p the people said to me, “Will you not tell us what these things*i signify*i to us, that you behave so?”
Then*p I answered them, “The word of the Lord*s came to me, saying,

‘Speak to the house of Israel, “Thus says the Lord God:*s ‘Behold, I will profane My sanctuary, your arrogant boast, the desire of your eyes, the delight of your soul; and your sons and daughters whom you left behind shall fall by the sword.
And you shall do as I have done; you shall not cover your*i lips nor eat man’s bread of*i sorrow.*i
Your turbans shall be on your heads and your sandals on your feet; you shall neither mourn nor weep, but you shall pine away in your iniquities and mourn with one another.
Thus Ezekiel is a sign to you; according to all that he has done you shall do; and when this comes, you shall know that I am*i the Lord God.’”*s

‘And*p you, son of man— will*i it*i not be*i in the day when I take from them their stronghold, their joy and their glory, the desire of their eyes, and that on which they set their minds, their sons and their daughters:
that*i on that day one who escapes will come to you to let you*i hear it*i with your*i ears?
On that day your mouth will be opened to him who has escaped; you shall speak and no longer be mute. Thus you will be a sign to them, and they shall know that I am*i the Lord.’”*s
